reviewText:
A very solid game with nice mechanics and stable condition. I dont understand the bad reviews about this game, because its a Forestry Simulator as it should be.

pro:
- very stable, had at least my 60 fps

- nice physics, graphics as good as usual for a simulator

cons:

reviewText:
I really don't get why so much hate on this game. It does what it says and does it nicely. The gameplay is smooth enough, graphics aren't top notch but not ugly or outdated as people say it is.

You get to experience a perfect one kind of simulation:
You got to take care of a forest and its differnt types of trees. Master using the machines and the money available will INCREASE a lot, helping you out on the economy side of the game. There is a nice bunch of tools and machines - from chainsaws to harvesters, cranes, trucks or tractors - at your disposal, you tend to orders and try to max your skills within different areas of the gameplay.

The world where you play cicles day and night, which end to be two total different styles of play in my opinion. Concerning the graphic design of the game, I found the HUD very easy to understand and use. It is my first time playing this type of game (Forestry) so I cannot compare to the previews editions, but this one right here is a great game and I am pretty sure you won't regret getting it.

reviewText: A few people complained that all you do is chop wood. That's kinda the whole point of the game. It delivers what it promises: Running a forestry business. I'm now saving for the next big upgrade.

reviewText:
Forestry 2017 - The Simulation is exactly what it says it is and what it is supossed to do. Just by watching the trailer you will get aclear understanding of what the game is about, but I can further explain that you will play with lots of tools associated with, of course, the theme: forestry simulation.

My experience with it was very pleasant, smooth gameplay together with fancy visuals and neat sounds. I particularly like to try mastering the machines as soon as possible because it will help a lot on winning more revenue from all actions. The main purpose will be to expand your company, and to do so you will need to sell a lot of woosd logs and other related products.

Forestry 17 is a great title, aware of any other forestry simulator out there. BUT!!!!! ---> Needs Steam Trading Cards!!!

reviewText:
well, I played this game for an hour and I have to say I also enjoyed a lot ...
the game is very nice and not boring ... I love simulation games I haven't found
other forestry games to compare this with, but so far it looks pretty solid, and although
there's still a little something to improve the game is already very nice and
well organized. The commands to use are few and easy to remember, the game map
is very very big but thanks to the little browser that is located on the bottom
left of the game window you orient very well! There is a lot of work to do in the
forest, cutting trees, selling them and always in the company of a horse that
helps us in our work! Finally, you say, well if you are fans of the genre I'd
recommend it!

reviewText:
A Woodcutting Simulatorhttps://youtu.be/J-81b-RuY9I
If you are wondering why I'm like the only one leaving a positive review be sure to check out the video above, as far as simulators go I actually had a bit more fun with this game than I probably should have.

+ Good country / rock soundtrack
+ A nice progression system where you eventually work your way up to better vehicles, along with hiring staff and so fourth (although I didn't make it that far)
+ Controls are pretty simple but everything seems to work well (I was surprised at how well the Jeep drove, even off-road it was pretty realistic)
+ The map is HUGE with multiple sawmills you will never run out of trees (well...eventually you might)
+ Visually it looks pretty nice, with a day/night cycle, although the houses and textures could be improved a bit.

- The game feels lifeless, there is only a couple other player models besides yourself in the world
- Very repetitive
- Not a whole lot of content or things to do, you will grind a lot just to unlock a few vehicles that will make things slightly easier
- No tutorial

~ I do feel like the game could have actually been a bit more enjoyable if it supported co-op multiplayer although that's hard to expect from a simulation game.

As far as simulators go this is actually pretty decent.

reviewText:
Get this game if you like the feel of nature and working on building your own company.
because thats what the game is about
it starts as a wood cutter with just a chainsaw and horse,
you slowly build up your ranks and get more choices of tools to use
-
This game is also good for the RPG fans, you can level up in it!
The more trees you chop, the more money you get, the better things you can buy
For me as a mainly-rpg player, this game felt like its worth playing
-
The graphics of this game are awesome too!
If you think about it, the game is only around 1GB in size, and has better graphics than many new games i played.
-
Theres 2-3 small bugs i encountered, which are rather funny, but nothing game breakable
(just saying horse + mountain"

reviewText:
I tried to give this game a decent go, however after just an hours play i was greatly disappointed.
You start off with the horse, which is okay i guess. But as soon as you gain the funds to purchase the first logging trailer, the controls are that badly configured that i had spent 2 whole game days just trying to load them.
There is no way of slowing down time and as soon as night sets in, you may aswell give up as there are no rear lights on your tractor/horse etc.
The only thing that did work well with this game was the refund system.

reviewText:
As I loaded my lip with Copenhagen and poured whiskey into my glass, I felt the hair on my face thicken. Long have I awaited the moment when I can become a true lumberjack.

Day 1 into my new profession was simple and yet ultimate bliss. I started it all off by picking up my trusty steed sprinkles. I assume I raised the horse however the whiskey had already began to run its course altering my thought process.
As we began our 35 yard adventure to the nearest tree I began to grow hair on my chest at the thought of my first kill.
Without further hesitation I spam every button, eventually finding my chainsaw, and cutting the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ down Gears of War style. Defeated at last, the monster fell.
The corpse, laying gently on the ground, was staring at me. With sap gushing out of its newly opened wound like a river after a heavy flood. I look back at it with nothing more than a grin, while the humming of my chainsaw was teeth rattling music to my ears. I couldn't hold back any longer I began to dismember him. Limb. by. Limb.

Day 2 basically the same thing but at this point I was already way too drunk to care about the minor details.

Day 3 im reely dunk lool

The game isn't "bad"
date: but it's not the best thing I've ever played.\nIt has bugs
recommended: glitches and other stuff but it plays just fine. It just needs to be polished up. It is exactly how they describe it on the store page. You cut ♥♥♥♥ing trees.\nIf you want to support the game
voteText: then don't. Simple."

reviewText:
Product received for free

Pros: It's a pretty straight forward game with control suggestions in the lower right corner, which I liked. It was a good click-then-achievement type game, especially where people are interested in linear goals and clear-cut objectives. I liked the wavy grass! The physics could be quite entertaining in the game. I count this as a pro because it provided some comic relief. Who knows where the tree's going next?!?! NO ONE!

Cons: The lighting at night was pitch black, which most games there's SOME lighting so you can make sure you're not walking into walls and stuff...I'd recommend a bit more ambient lighting. The controls could use a little work. My poor horse got stuck going in circles a lot. :( Poor horsie. I think if the vehicles didn't get stuck in a perpetual circle motion occassionally the controls would be just fine.
